definition: to love each other
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to feel attached to/to long for/to love

sentences.english: To be in love is to enter a delicate relationship of mutual influence and attachment.
sentences.chinese: 二人相恋是一种彼此影响，互相连结的微妙关系。

sentences.english: The first, the one you should not meet, so then you may not love .
sentences.chinese: 仓央嘉措第一最好不相见，如此便可不相恋。

sentences.english: The brain areas associated with intense romantic love, still become active, 25 years later.
sentences.chinese: 在相恋25年后，大脑中与热恋的区域仍然活跃。

sentences.english: Daniel fell in love with his girlfriend 8 years of good news to the media.
sentences.chinese: 相恋8年旳吴彦祖与女友向各媒体报喜。

sentences.english: They bust up after six years of steady companionship.
sentences.chinese: 他们在相恋六年后分手了。

sentences.english: In a short time, José and Clemencia fell in love and wanted to marry as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 在短短的时间，何塞和克莱门相恋，并希望尽快结婚。

sentences.english: In your present life she fell in love with you just to repay the favor you had done for her in last life.
sentences.chinese: 她今生和你相恋，只为还你一个情。

sentences.english: A veteran's prosthesis: he was once in love with his doctor.
sentences.chinese: 一位退伍军人的义肢，他曾与自己的复健师相恋。

sentences.english: It's rumored recently that he's in love with 20-year-old Hong Kong singer and actress Isabella Leung.
sentences.chinese: 最近有传他与20岁的香港女星梁洛施相恋。

sentences.english: Eventually, Ran has fallen into this guardian angel.
sentences.chinese: 不知不觉地，永然与这个守护天使相恋了。

sentences.english: Tell you how much I love you, there will be some Yique fell in love.
sentences.chinese: 告诉你我有多爱你，相恋里会有些遗缺。

sentences.english: Love is the veil between lover and lover.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是一层纱布，隔在相恋的人中间。

sentences.english: Mr Key and his wife are high school sweethearts, who married in 1984.
sentences.chinese: 基与其太太是高中相恋，1984年成婚。

sentences.english: Chicagoan Upchurch began to date Michelle, then 18 or so, as her first-ever boyfriend when they were high school students.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔约18岁时和芝加哥的高中同学大卫相恋。

to love each other

to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
to achieve Buddhahood through one's efforts and insight/to obtain a positive outcome after sustained efforts/to come to fruition
(dialect) to date sb
to live together
to part company/to split up/to break up

to get married
to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
